author: OKFN
name: eu-echo
notes:
Database of humanitarian projects funded by ECHO and EU member states. PDF spending overviews.
## Details
The European Union as a whole (i.e., the Member States and the Commission) is one of the world's main humanitarian aid donors; the Humanitarian Aid department (ECHO) is the service of the European Commission responsible for this activity.
ECHO humanitarian data is based on ECHO's financial management database HOPE (Humanitarian Office Programme Environment), in operation since 1996, and ABAC, the corporate financial management system used by the European Commission. The Member States of the European Union have agreed to inform ECHO when they approve funding for humanitarian aid, using a 14-point report system.

extras.value: Site very slow to retrieve data. Data can only be viewed one year at a time.

Donor, Amount, Recipient country(ies) / World region(s) and breakdown, Crisis/Disaster, Date of decision, Financial year, Project code, NGO channels, Local implementing agency, Area of destination, Description of aid, Beneficiary group, Aid sector(s), Type of aid, Duration, Budgetary source, Name and tel. no. of contact person, Embargo date, Description of relief items and services provided, Transport, Estimated date/place of arrival.

The European Union as a whole (i.e., the Member States and the Commission) is one of the world's main humanitarian aid donors; the Humanitarian Aid department (ECHO) is the service of the European Commission responsible for this activity. ECHO humanitarian data is based on ECHO's financial management database HOPE (Humanitarian Office Programme Environment), in operation since 1996, and ABAC, the corporate financial management system used by the European Commission. The Member States of the European Union have agreed to inform ECHO when they approve funding for humanitarian aid, using a 14-point report system.

European Commission, Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, United Kingdom

Free to be re-used as long as attribution is given. The Copyright notice (http://ec.europa.eu/geninfo/legal_notices_en.htm#copyright) on the European Commission website states: "Reproduction is authorised, provided the source is acknowledged, save where otherwise stated.Where prior permission must be obtained for the reproduction or use of textual and multimedia information (sound, images, software, etc.), such permission shall cancel the above-mentioned general permission and shall clearly indicate any restrictions on use." Further info see: http://www.ckan.net/package/eu-echo-funding
Database of humanitarian projects funded by ECHO and EU member states. PDF spending overviews.
Peter Zangl (Director-General), Nadine Wraith (Sector Internal Audit & Advice), Henrike Trautmann (Assistant to the DG).
